Sodiers mail
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tennessee
U.S.A.
2ndLtCole
Souilly France
March 23 1919
Dear Ellen:-
Will write you a few lines this evening Althou I havent heard from you in almost two weeks
I can't imagine why I dont hear from any one as often as I use too I get so little mail now and I use to get a bunch most every week
I wonder if you are
forgetting your me.
I sure hope not.
But of course I can never tell for I am a long ways from Jackson and I cant see every thing now like I could one time
But if you are write and tell me and then I wont be in a hurry to get home.
This is a nice day and
if I were only back home I know it is murch nicer

It snowed here all day thursday but was soon gone. We can never tell what it is going to do here in this country. I was over to visit Lin all last sunday afernoon and until bed time at night had supper with him.
I am looking for him
to come over to see me to night any way.
I thank he will if he is till here in this town but he may be out on the road some where his company runs around over the country a great deal.
We are about a mile apart but we never see each other until I go over or he comes over to see me.
I thank the 79 Dir will leave here some time next month
And then will soon start home.
Sure wish I could go with them
you should have seen me out playing base ball this evening didnt know was so good I know will have a hard time to morrow
for is the first time I have run in a long time
we had a pretty good minstral show here in camp last week of couse you would call it a bad one but we see a show so soldiers are thank any thing is good
There is going to be some kind of a
show here monday night, what do you say? "less go"
well I cant thank of any more to write this time
now write me real often and be sweet
with love
Fayette
